body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.8.0-dev-nightly-12-g977790746

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Linux r4 5.18.0-1-amd64 1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 5.18.2-1 (2022-06-06) x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Terminal name/version

N/A

### $TERM environment variable

N/A

### Installation

Appimage

### How to reproduce the issue

```
nvim --headless --cmd 'call rpcrequest(stdioopen({"rpc":v:true}),"nvim_command","echo hello")' >/tmp/tmp
```

### Expected behavior

Rpc request is written to /tmp/tmp.

### Actual behavior

Segfault without anything being written to the file. Removing the redirection makes the crash disappear.

Piping to `tee /tmp/tmp` instead of directly redirecting to a file is a suitable workaround for my usecase.

title: Segfault when `--headless rpcrequest(stioopen({}),...)` is redirected to file
